instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 inch Mid 2010 restarting randomly
threads.message:
Hi Guys, I have this MOBO: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a and it is restarting randomly and makes the three beeps, IDA test says cpu panic report.

I already replace the <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, but still is restarting. (and of course i already test with new RAM)

Please advise how to proceed.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 inch Mid 2010 restarting randomly
threads.message: Try on slot at a time and max out the working one....

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 inch Mid 2010 restarting randomly
threads.message: I already did all the basic staff before to ask in this forum. I tried with just one module of ram and i test both, but that doesn't solved the problem

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15 inch Mid 2010 restarting randomly
Macbook Pro 15 inch Mid 2010 restarting randomly
threads.message: If both RAM slots give the same error it is probably a dead CPU or cracked traces/balls under it. Not worth fixing in my eyes.
